Properties.ProtectedString:
local Tool = script.Parent;
local stillEquipped = true function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end
while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to Go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png"
while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(.01) end
print("Setting Mouse To Wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png"
while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

-- RHKMan!! --
-- Have a handle to the game service in case we need to get the time object r = game:service("RunService")
-- Tool and the Object, in this case RHKMan local Tool = script.Parent
-- Just a partial lock, which disallows multiple instances of the onActivated function Tool.Enabled = true
-- Initialize the Animation variable local RHKAnim = nil
-- Damage!! local RHK_damage = 50
-- To Connect with our blow function local connection = nil
-- RHK Sound File local RHKS = Instance.new("Sound") RHKS.SoundId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=45763159" RHKS.Parent = Tool RHKS.Volume = 1.0
--Blow function, called when the character touches another character function blow(hit) if cantHitNow then return end -- find, the humanoid object of the character that got hit local humanoid = hit.Parent:findFirstChild("Humanoid") -- Find the our tool's character local vCharacter = Tool.Parent -- Get a handle to our player from the game space local vPlayer = game.Players:playerFromCharacter(vCharacter) -- Get the humanoid object our the player character local hum = vCharacter:findFirstChild("Humanoid") -- if the humanoid object is not nil and is not the same as the hit character if humanoid~= nil and humanoid ~= hum and hum ~= nil then -- Get the handle to the left leg local left_leg = vCharacter:FindFirstChild("Left Leg") if(left_leg ~= nil) then -- If the left leg of the player tocuhes the humanoid then tag him tagHumanoid(humanoid, vPlayer) -- Do the @#$% damage to him humanoid:TakeDamage(RHK_damage) if connection then connection:disconnect() connection = nil end wait(1.0) -- and untag him after a second so that the damage isn't applied continously untagHumanoid(humanoid) end end end
-- Tagging and Untagging are done for leaderboards to find the source of the incoming damage -- Function, to tag the player to the humanoid object function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) local creator_tag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") -- Creates a value for the player and makes the humanoid its parent creator_tag.Value = player creator_tag.Name = "creator" creator_tag.Parent = humanoid end
-- Function, to untag the player from the humanoid function untagHumanoid(humanoid) if humanoid ~= nil then -- Check if the creator tag is enabled local tag = humanoid:findFirstChild("creator") if tag ~= nil then -- if so, nullify the tag tag.Parent = nil end end end -- Actions to do when an item is activated function onActivated() -- Make the Ninja potion transparent Tool.Handle.Transparency = 1 -- Tentative lock, to disable multiple instances of this function if not Tool.Enabled then return end -- Check if the handle to the Player is still available in the space local MyPlayer = Tool.Parent if MyPlayer == nil then return end
-- Get a handle to the Torso of our character to rotate it local MyTorso = Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("Torso") if MyTorso == nil then return end
-- Check to see if the humanoid is still in the world local MyHumanoid= MyPlayer:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if MyHumanoid == nil then return end
-- Get a handle to the left leg of our character to check for hit local MyLeftLeg = Tool.Parent:FindFirstChild("Left Leg") if MyLeftLeg == nil then return end
Tool.Enabled = false
-- Load the Animation RHKAnim = MyHumanoid:LoadAnimation(Tool.RHK2) -- Play Animation RHKAnim:Play()
-- Here, we are creating different frames of reference for our character's -- torso, so that we can rotate him 360 degrees. 6 steps of 60 deg each torsoFrame1 = MyTorso.CFrame * CFrame.Angles(0, 1*math.pi/3, 0) torsoFrame2 = MyTorso.CFrame * CFrame.Angles(0, 2*math.pi/3, 0) torsoFrame3 = MyTorso.CFrame * CFrame.Angles(0, math.pi, 0) torsoFrame4 = MyTorso.CFrame * CFrame.Angles(0, 4*math.pi/3, 0) torsoFrame5 = MyTorso.CFrame * CFrame.Angles(0, 5*math.pi/3, 0) torsoFrame6 = MyTorso.CFrame
-- Applying a force in the direction that we require on the body bodyGyro = Instance.new("BodyGyro") bodyGyro.P = 100000 bodyGyro.D = 3000 bodyGyro.maxTorque = Vector3.new(bodyGyro.P, bodyGyro.P, bodyGyro.P) bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame1 bodyGyro.Parent = MyTorso
-- The Animation lasts for a total of 0.8 seconds -- Match the Torso rotation with the animation wait(.4/3) bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame2 wait(.4/3) -- Make the character jump for the kick MyHumanoid.Jump = true -- Check for the blow hit only after the character has jumped connection = MyLeftLeg.Touched:connect(blow)
-- play the sound RHKS:Play() bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame3 wait(.4/3) bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame4 wait(.4/3) bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame5 wait(.4/3) bodyGyro.cframe = torsoFrame6 wait(.4/3)
wait(.5) -- Once the animation is played, disable the connection so that damage isn't -- applied for normal left leg collisions if connection then connection:disconnect() connection = nil end bodyGyro:remove() wait(.5)
Tool.Enabled = true -- Bring back the Ninja Potion! Tool.Handle.Transparency = 0 end
-- On Equip re-enable our sound function onEquipped() RHKS.Volume = 1.0 end
-- On Unequip, stop the animation, remove the sound and disable the connection function onUnequipped() if RHKAnim ~= nil then RHKAnim:Stop() end if connection then connection:disconnect() connection = nil end if RHKS ~= nil then RHKS:Stop() RHKS.Volume = 0.0 end end
-- Connect our function to the Tool's Activate and other interfaces Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
